Mass rallies held 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies were held in different parts of the country to carry out the tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial to the letter.
 Rallies in north Hwanghae and Ryanggang provinces and Nampho called for turning out as one in an onward march to effect a new upswing in socialist construction under the army-first revolutionary guidance of leader Kim Jong Il. 
 It was noted at the rallies that it serves as a sure guarantee for pushing ahead with socialist advance under the red flag to glorify the revolutionary traditions of Mt. Paektu.   
 The rallies called on people to become performers of exploits in a proud struggle to consolidate national economic potentials commensurate with the 21st century.

Reception given by Indian ambassador 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by Binanda Kumar Gogoi, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, yesterday on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Republic of India and on the occasion of the New Year. 
 Present on invitation were Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the central committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions  of Korea, who is chairman of the Korea-India Friendship Association, Pak Kil Yon, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Abolition of SL demanded
articles.content:
Unionists of S. Korean Academy of Science and Technology on strike 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Unionists of the South Korean Academy of Science and Technology, who have been on a total strike against the authorities' unilateral restructuring for about 20 days, went on a sit-in strike on January 5, according to South Korean "Yonhap News" (internet.)
 The trade union in a statement said that it decided to go on the sit-in strike against the authorities' selection of those to be fired without any agreement with the union and declared it "would continue the strike in defence of employment security and vital rights, ready for being arrested."    
 It was reported that the trade union has been on strike against the authorities' restructuring of institutes, the third since October last year.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on WPK's all-embracing politics
articles.content:
Abolition of SL demanded 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Over 40 members of the Federation of South Korean Youth in the United States held a demonstration in demand of the abolition of the "Security Law" in front of the South Korean consulate general in Los Angeles and New York and conveyed a letter of protest to it on January 5, according to the South Korean newspaper Hangyore (internet).
 They in the letter urged the abolition of the SL, release of prisoners of conscience, establishment of human rights committee, probe into the truth behind the doubtful human deaths and halt to the suppression of the workers' strikes for their vital rights.
